programme.title: Latest News - Red Moon Rising
programme.desc: In 2021, it achieved an average of more than one launch per week for the first time in its orbital spaceflight history, making it the busiest year for its space program to date. We watched the country pass many milestones from successfully landing its first rover on Mars and test flying a hypersonic spaceplane to building the core module for its Tiangong space station and launching the first taikonauts onto the said module. Duration: 420

programme.title: Helen Ramirez - On the Border of a New Frontier
programme.desc: Space Channel Crews caught up with Helen Ramirez (Brownsville’s Deputy City Manager) to discuss her efforts to build a wholistic space ecosystem in the Rio Grande Valley. From rockets to investment and communications, the City of Brownsville is leading the way as Texas becomes the epicenter for America’s new space economy. Duration: 277

programme.title: Silicon Valley of Space
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley of Space, quietly building a Gateway to Mars on the Texas/Mexico border. Duration: 195

programme.title: Test Fail Test Again
programme.desc: By copying the attitudes of astronauts before him a young man Questions what it means to be an explorer. He builds janky model rockets and tests them to see if one day he might be able to launch himself into space. Duration: 206

programme.title: Phobos Bounce
programme.desc: Phobos is one of two very small satellites of the planet Mars. ... The moons are named after the children of the Greek god Ares - who, like the Roman Mars, is the god of war. Deimos means 'terror' or 'panic' and Phobos means 'fear'. Phobos has an equatorial orbit, which is almost circular. Duration: 472

programme.title: Future Galaxy Explorer
programme.desc: A story from the point of view of an 8 year old girl training to become a future astronaut in hopes of being the first female to step foot on the moon and explore the galaxy. It’s a story about equal opportunity and how all things are possible no matter the challenge. Duration: 509

programme.title: Spotlight - Micah Walter-Range
programme.desc: Micah is the President of Caelus Partners. He leads all operational aspects of Caelus Partners’ business globally, manages resource alignment and prioritization, and ensures efficient and effective operations. He is also an owner and a board member of Caelus Partners. Micah created and manages the underlying stock index for the world’s first exchange-traded fund (ETF) focused on the space industry, enabling easy access to space companies for a more diverse range of investors. Duration: 180

programme.title: Space for Humanity - Power of Perspective
programme.desc: Perspective forms the foundation of our perception and informs our behavior. We believe the Overview Effect can provide us with the perspective shift that will help us heal our relationship with our planet and inspire us to effectively address our world’s most intractable challenges. Duration: 635

programme.title: Campus Movie Fest - Campus Movie Fest
programme.desc: An ET invasion, hatched in the minds of three college students Duration: 315

programme.title: Morning at Starbase
programme.desc: Boca Chica is a striking landscape with a unique history and provocative future. A beach community, home to migrating birds, sea turtles and what could be the future of America’s Space Program. Duration: 210

programme.title: Health Report - Health in Space
programme.desc: Last month a study of 5 Male Cosmonauts raised serious concerns about the safety of long term space travel. Duration: 495

programme.title: Virgin Galactic launch recap
programme.desc: Watch Space Channel's coverage of the historic first crewed flight of Virgin Galactic's SpaceShipTwo. With special guests relive the moments Virgin Galactic made history for commercial spaceflight. Duration: 721

programme.title: First Space Hotel
programme.desc: the Gateway Foundation released plans for a cruise ship-style hotel that could one day float above the Earth's atmosphere. This futuristic concept, comprised of 24 modules connected by elevator shafts that make up a rotating wheel orbiting the Earth is scheduled to be fully operational by 2027. Duration: 276

programme.title: Orbital Reef
programme.desc: Billionare funded rocket launches, civilian astronauts, commercial satellites, what's next you ask? How about a private space station. Duration: 591

programme.title: Overview with Frank White - The Next Overview Effect from Mars
programme.desc: We live at a critical moment in human history. The challenges of climate change, food, water and energy shortages as well as the increasing disparity between the developed and developing nations are testing our will to unite, while differences in religions, cultures, and politics continue to keep us apart. The creation of a “global village” through satellite TV and the Internet is still struggling to connect the world into one community. At this critical moment, our greatest need is for a global vision of planetary unity and purpose for humanity as a whole. Duration: 980

programme.title: Space Tourism on Mars
programme.desc: A Martian Feast without Matt Damon's potatoes! Local chefs took on the challenge to cook a meal with ingredients only found on Mars. Duration: 180

programme.title: Startups - Cosmic Shielding Corporation
programme.desc: CSC offers a multifunctional approach to radiation shielding by utilizing a patented composite material that also offers structural and thermal advantages. Duration: 180

programme.title: Sound of the Earth
programme.desc: For more than three decades, Grammy and Emmy nominated guitarist, composer, producer David Becker has continued to define himself as one of the best and most unique voices in jazz and contemporary music by combining diverse influences and a passion for the new and different, and his ability to play for the present while always keeping an eye on the past and future. He has led the critically acclaimed DAVID BECKER TRIBUNE to a worldwide audience by performing in more than 35 countries. Duration: 285

programme.desc: These ARE the droids you're looking for... Duration: 60

programme.desc: Our team of endless scrollers takes on the auto-verse as NASA rolls out their newest set of wheels. Duration: 344

programme.title: Jeff Bezos launch to Space!
programme.desc: Watch Jeff Bezos, his brother Mark, Wally Funk, & Oliver Daemen launch to Space on the first crewed New Shepard flight Duration: 961

programme.title: Space Force Automation Spectrum
programme.desc: Aaron's research deals with human decision making when paired with Artificial Intelligence, autonomous systems, or other types of artificial systems. Specifically, research questions revolve around advisor trust using human confidence as an implicit measure of advisor trust when receiving advice or working in a human-machine team. In other words, my research aims to uncover methods to maximize appropriate human-machine interaction. Other areas of interest include the effects of anthropomorphism, algorithmic expressions of confidence, user cognitive load, user affective states, and other dispositional traits of the user on human advice seeking and use. Duration: 570

programme.title: Glenna Burman - Big Bang
programme.desc:
This is one of eight entirely original symphonic works with accompanying space videos that are being created for the "Origins: Life and the Universe" concert to benefit the Astrobiology Program at the University of Washington. The spectacular audiovisual concert will be held on Saturday, November 7, 2015, at Benaroya Hall in Seattle. (astrobioconcert.com).
Glenna Burmer composed the original score, which was recorded at Bastyr Chapel with David Sabee as conductor and the NW Sinfonia Orchestra. She initially conceptualized the stages of evolution of our Universe using a combination of originally created video, licensed imagery and public domain images from the great astronomy organizations, including NASA, the Hubble telescope, IRFU-CEA, ESO, ESA, JPL, and many others. CGI animation of the colliding Universes before the Big Bang, the Laniakea sequence (a collaboration between Deep Sky Studios and Daniel Pomarede, IRFU-CEA, France), and video post-production effects were by Deep Sky Studios. The video and concert are produced by Burmer Music, LLC, copyright 2015. Duration: 653

programme.title: Unidentified - Our Biological Universe
programme.desc:
What we perceive as reality, is a product of our consciousness. An external reality, if it existed, would by definition have to exist in the framework of space and time. But space and time are not independent realities but rather tools of the human and animal mind. Our external and internal perceptions are inextricably intertwined (different sides of the same coin that cannot be separated). The behavior of sub atomic particles (all particles and objects) is inextricably linked to the presence of a conscious observer. without a conscious observer, they (at best) exist in an undetermined state of probability wave. Without consciousness, matter dwells in an undetermined state of probability. any universe preceding consciousness, only existed in a probability state. The very structure of the universe is explainable only through biocentrism. The Universe is finely tuned to support an observer, which makes sense because life creates the universe, not the other way around. it is simply the complete spacial temporal logic of the self. Time does not have a real existence outside of animal sense perception. it is the process by which we perceive changes in the universe. Space, like time, is not an object or thing. space is another form of our animal understanding. and does not have an independent reality. we carry space and time around with us like turtles with shells. there is no absolute self existing matrix in which physical events occur independent of life
Duration: 78

programme.desc: We believe the best people to colonize Mars are economists because they enjoy housing bubbles Duration: 170

programme.title: Latest News - Tide in Space
programme.desc: SpaceX sent Tide detergent to astronauts on the ISS so they can figure out how to do laundry for long-haul trips to Mars. Astronauts on the ISS received a shipment of items onboard a SpaceX spacecraft on Wednesday. The shipment included specially-developed laundry detergent made by Tide. Duration: 210
